translated: Having summoned him, he bound him by his power, but the untamed one bit him in anger.

original: sa tīvrāṃ kharāṃ kaṭukāṃ vedanāṃ vedayati /
analyzed: sa tīvrām kharām kaṭukām vedanām vedayati
translated: He experienced intense, sharp, and bitter pain.

original: yathā jānāmi ca me jīvitaṃ niruddham iti /
analyzed: yathā jānāmi ca me jīvitam niruddham iti
translated: As I know, my life is stopped.

analyzed: tatra bahavaḥ vādikāḥ āhutāḥ
translated: There many debaters were invited.

original: na ca kaścic chaknoti viṣaṃ cikitsitum /
analyzed: na ca kaścid śaknoti viṣam cikitsitum
translated: And no one was able to cure the poison.

original: atha traiva śūrpārake mahānagaravare vimalaviśuddhir nāmopāsikā prativasati sma /
analyzed: atha śūrpārake mahā nagara vare vimalaviśuddhiḥ nāma upāsikā prativasati sma
translated: Then in the great city of Śūrpāraka, there lived a laywoman named Vimalaviśuddhi.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā samanvāgatā tasya iyam mahāvidyā rājñī jihvā agre bhūt
translated: Endowed with great compassion, this great knowledge-queen was at the tip of her tongue.

original: sā tasyāntikam upasaṃkrāntā upasaṃkramyemāṃ mahāvidyāṃ pravartayāmāsa /
analyzed: sā tasya antikam upasaṃkrāntā upasaṃkramya imām mahāvidyām pravartayāmāsa
translated: She approached him and, having approached, she made this great knowledge-queen manifest.

original: sā tayaikavelāyām anusmṛtamātrayā nirviṣaṃ smṛtipratilabdhaṃ kṛtvā tato mahāvyasanāt parimocayitvā imām eva śuddhiputre mahāvidyāṃ hṛdayagatāṃ 🔽kārayati sma /
analyzed: sā tayā eka velāyām anusmṛta mātrayā nirviṣam smṛti pratilabdham kṛtvā tatas mahā vyasanāt parimocayitvā imām eva śuddhiputre mahā vidyām hṛdaya gatām  kārayati sma
translated: By merely remembering her once, she made him free from poison and regain his memory, and thus delivered him from that great calamity, and caused him to keep this very great knowledge-queen, the daughter of Śuddhiputrī, in his heart.

analyzed: yathā vidhivat anujñātam iti
translated: And he caused it to be done as it was duly permitted.

original: api ca mahābrāhmaṇa kiṃ parijñātam iti /
analyzed: api ca mahābrāhmaṇa kim parijñātam iti
translated: Moreover, O great brāhmaṇa, what is known?

original: bārāṇāsyāṃ mahānagaryām anupūrveṇānuvicaramāṇo rājā brahmadatta iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: bārāṇāsyām mahā nagaryām anupūrveṇa anuvicaramāṇaḥ rājā brahmadattaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: In the great city of Vārāṇasī, wandering in due order, the king known as Brahmadatta.

original: tasya prātisīmiko balacakrarājā caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ saṃnāhya bārāṇasīmahānagarīṃ parivārya vināśayitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya prātisīmikaḥ bala cakra rājā caturaṅga balakāyam saṃnāhya bārāṇasī mahā nagarīm parivārya vināśayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: His neighboring king, the wheel-turning king of the four divisions of the army, having arrayed the army, surrounded the great city of Vārāṇasī, and began to destroy it.

analyzed: tatas rājñā brahmadattasya amātyaiḥ niveditam
translated: Then the king's ministers reported to Brahmadatta,

analyzed: deva para cakreṇa nagaram apahṛtam
translated: Your Majesty, the enemy's army has taken the city.

original: tataḥ kiṃ tu khalu vayam upāyaṃ kuryāmo yenaitat paracakraṃ vinaśyet /
analyzed: tatas kim tu khalu vayam upāyam kuryāmaḥ yena etat para cakram vinaśyet
translated: What should we do now, by what means can we destroy that enemy's army?

analyzed: ājñām prayaccha
translated: Give us your command.

analyzed: rājā kathayati
translated: The king said,

analyzed: alpa utsukāḥ bhavantaḥ mā bhavata
translated: You should not be anxious.

analyzed: asti mama mahāpratisarā nāma vidyā rājñī
translated: I have a vidya-raja named Mahapratisara.

analyzed: yena aham iha imam caturaṅga balakāyam parājeṣyāmi
translated: By which I will defeat this four-division army here.

analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmi
translated: I will do so.

analyzed: amātyāḥ śirasā praṇipatya ūcuḥ
translated: The ministers bowed their heads and said,

original: kim idaṃ mahārāja nāsmābhiḥ kadācid api na śrutam iti /
analyzed: kim idam mahā rāja na asmābhiḥ kadācid api na śrutam iti
translated: Your Majesty, we have never heard such a thing before.

analyzed: rājā prāha
translated: The king said,

analyzed: aham idānīm pratyakṣam darśanam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will now make it evident.

analyzed: atha sa rājā brahmadattaḥ
translated: Then King Brahmadatta,

original: nānāgandhodakena snātaḥ śirāḥ śucivastraṃ prāvṛtya imāṃ mahāpratisarāṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ
analyzed: nānā gandha udakena snātaḥ sirāḥ śuci vastram prāvṛtya imām mahāpratisarām mahāvidyā rājñīm
translated: having bathed with various fragrant waters, having put on a clean white cloth on his head, having written this Mahapratisara, the great vidya-raja,

original: yathāvidhinābhilikhya śiraḥ keśe 'vasthāpya imām eva mahāvidyārājñīṃ kavacaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: yathāvidhinā abhilikhya śiraḥ keśe vasthāpya imām eva mahāvidyā rājñīm kavacam kṛtvā
translated: according to the proper method, having placed it on his head in his hair, having made this very great vidya-raja into a protective armor,

analyzed: saṃgrāma madhye vatīrya ekākinā eva sarva asau caturaṅga balakāyaḥ parājitaḥ
translated: Having entered the middle of the battle alone, the entire four-division army was defeated.

original: āmarditaś ca tāvad yāvac caraṇaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: āmarditaḥ ca tāvat yāvat caraṇam gataḥ
translated: And he was oppressed until he went to the feet [of the Buddha].

analyzed: iti kṛtvā asau balacakra rājā muktaḥ iti
translated: Thus, that powerful Cakravartin king was released.

original: evaṃ hi mahābrāhmaṇa pratyakṣaṃ mahānubhāveyaṃ mahāvidyārājñī sarvatathāgatahṛdayamudrādhiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: evam hi mahā brāhmaṇa pratyakṣam mahā anubhāvā iyam mahāvidyā rājñī sarva tathāgata hṛdaya mudrā dhiṣṭhitā
translated: Thus, O great Brahmin, this great vidya-raja is indeed greatly powerful, sealed with the heart of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: pratyakṣam eva iti dhārayitavyā
translated: It should be upheld as being indeed directly perceived.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata samā eṣā draṣṭavyā
translated: It should be seen as equal to all Tathagatas.

original: ye kecit paścime kāle paścime samaye alpāyuṣkānāṃ mandabhāgyānāṃ mandadhānyānaṃ parīttabhāgyānāṃ satvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya draṣṭavyā
analyzed: ye kecid paścime kāle paścime samaye alpa āyuṣkānām mandabhāgyānām parītta bhāgyānām satvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: For the sake, benefit, and happiness of all beings in the future time, in the future period, who have short lives, who are unfortunate, who have little grain, who have little luck,

original: yaḥ kaścin mahābrāhmaṇa imāṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ yathāvidhinā likhitvā bāhau kaṇṭhe dhārayiṣyati /🔽sa sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhito veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid mahā brāhmaṇaḥ imām mahāvidyā rājñīm yathāvidhinā likhitvā bāhau kaṇṭhe dhārayiṣyati  sa sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhitaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Whoever, O great Brahmin, having written this great vidya-raja according to the proper method, will wear it on the arm or neck,🔽he should be known as empowered by all Tathagatas.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata kāyaḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the body of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: vajra kāyaḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the vajra body.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata dhātu garbhaḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the womb of the essence of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata netraḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the eye of all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: jvālita arci śarīraḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the one whose body is ablaze with light.

original: abhedyakavaca iti veditavyaḥ /🔽sa sarvaśatrūṇāṃ pramathana iti veditavyaḥ /🔽sarvapāpāvaraṇanirdahana iti veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: abhedya kavacaḥ iti veditavyaḥ  sa sarva śatrūṇām pramathanaḥ iti veditavyaḥ  sarva pāpa āvaraṇa nirdahanaḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the one with an impenetrable armor.🔽He should be known as the one who crushes all enemies.🔽He should be known as the one who burns away all the obscurations of evil.

analyzed: sarva naraka gati viśodhanaḥ iti veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as the one who purifies all the destinies of the hells.

original: kim iti pūrvaṃ parijñātaṃ mahābrāhmaṇa anyatamasmiṃ pṛthivīpradeśe bhikṣuśrāddhas
analyzed: kim iti pūrvam parijñātam mahā brāhmaṇa anyatamasmin pṛthivī pradeśe bhikṣu śrāddhaḥ
translated: What was previously known, great Brahmin? In a certain region of the earth, there was a faithful monk

analyzed: tathāgata kula śikṣā khaṇḍakaḥ datta ādāyī sukha advāra hārakaḥ saṃghikam cāturdiśikam staupikam
translated: who violated the training of the Tathagata's family, was a thief, took what was not given, and appropriated the property of the Sangha, the four directions, and the stupas,🔽and made it his own, and appropriated it all.

original: gaṇaprāptaṃ ca yad dravyaṃ tat paudgalikaṃ kṛtvā sarvam adhiṣṭhāya takṣayati /🔽yāvad apareṇa samayena mahāvyādhinā pṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: gaṇa prāptam ca yat dravyam tat paudgalikam kṛtvā sarvam adhiṣṭhāya takṣayati  yāvat apareṇa samayena mahā vyādhinā pṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Later, he became afflicted with a serious illness.

analyzed: sa mahatīm duḥkha āvedanām anubhavati
translated: He experienced great suffering.

analyzed: sa tapasvī atrāṇaḥ parāyaṇaḥ pratiśaraṇaḥ mahāntasukrośaṇāśabdam karoti
translated: The ascetic, without protection, without refuge, without support, cried out in great distress.

original: atha tasminn eva pṛthivīpradeśe upāsako brāhmaṇo prativasati /
analyzed: atha tasmin eva pṛthivī pradeśe upāsakaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati
translated: Then, in that very region of the earth, there lived a lay follower, a Brahmin.

analyzed: tena tad śabdaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: He heard that sound.

original: śrutvā ca punar yena sa bhikṣus tenopasaṃkrānta upasaṃkramya tasya bhikṣor imāṃ mahāpratisarāṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ likhitvā kaṇṭhe badhnāti sma
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar yena sa bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ upasaṃkramya tasya bhikṣoḥ imām mahāpratisarām mahāvidyā rājñīm likhitvā kaṇṭhe badhnāti sma
translated: Having heard it, he approached the place where the bhikṣu was. Having approached, he wrote out this Mahāpratisarā Mahāvidyā Rājñī and tied it around the bhikṣu's neck.

original: samanantarabaddhāyāṃ mahāpratisarāyāṃ mahāvidyārājñyāṃ tasya bhikṣoḥ sarvā vedanāḥ
analyzed: samanantara baddhāyām mahāpratisarāyām mahāvidyā rājñyām tasya bhikṣoḥ sarvāḥ vedanāḥ
translated: As soon as the Mahāpratisarā Mahāvidyā Rājñī was tied on, all the pain of that bhikṣu

original: praśāntāḥ sarvavyādhibhyaḥ parimuktaḥ svasthaḥ saṃvṛtta iti /
analyzed: praśāntāḥ sarva vyādhibhyaḥ parimuktaḥ svasthaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ iti
translated: was pacified, he was freed from all illnesses and became well.

original: tasyām eva rātryām atyayābhyupasthite smṛtipratilabdhaḥ kālagataḥ /
analyzed: tasyām eva rātryām atyaya abhyupasthite smṛti pratilabdhaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: When that night had passed, he regained his memory and died.

original: tasminn eva kṣatravare utsṛṣṭo 'vīcau mahānarake upapannaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin eva kṣatra vare utsṛṣṭaḥ vīcau mahā narake upapannaḥ
translated: He was cast out in that very cremation ground and was reborn in the great Avīci hell.

original: tac ca tasya mṛtaśarīraṃ bhikṣubhiḥ kūṭe sthāpitam /
analyzed: tat ca tasya mṛta śarīram bhikṣubhiḥ kūṭe sthāpitam
translated: And that dead body of his was placed on a pyre by the bhikṣus.

original: sā ca tasya mahāpratisarā mahāvidyārājñī kaṇṭhe baddhaivāsthitā /
analyzed: sā ca tasya mahāpratisarā mahāvidyā rājñī kaṇṭhe baddhā eva āsthitā
translated: And that Mahāpratisarā Mahāvidyā Rājñī remained tied around his neck.

original: samanantaropapannasya tasya bhikṣos tasminn avīcau mahānarake teṣāṃ nārakānāṃ satvānāṃ sarvaduḥkhavedanāḥ śāntāḥ /
analyzed: samanantara upapannasya tasya bhikṣoḥ tasmin avīcau mahā narake teṣām nārakānām satvānām sarva duḥkha vedanāḥ śāntāḥ
translated: As soon as that bhikṣu was reborn in that Avīci great hell, all the painful sensations of those hell beings were pacified.

analyzed: te ca nāraka satvāḥ sarva sukha samarpitāḥ abhūvan
translated: And those hell beings became endowed with all happiness.

original: ye ca te mahāntaāvicikāagniskandhās te 'pi sarveṇa sarvam upaśāntā iti /
analyzed: ye ca te mahāntaḥ āvicikā agni skandhāḥ te pi sarveṇa sarvam upaśāntāḥ iti
translated: And those great masses of fire in the Avīci hell all completely subsided.

original: atha te yamapuruṣā vismayam āpannā yamasya dharmarājasyemaṃ niścayaṃ vistareṇārocayati sma //
analyzed: atha te yama puruṣāḥ vismayam āpannāḥ yamasya dharma rājasya imam niścayam vistareṇa ārocayati sma
translated: Then those Yama messengers, filled with wonder, fully reported this decision of Yama Dharmarāja.

analyzed: ati vismayam idam deva dṛṣyate naraka saṃkaṭe
translated: This is a great wonder, O Lord, seen in the calamity of hell.

original: praśāntā dāruṇā duḥkhāḥ satvānāṃ karmajāś ca ye /
analyzed: praśāntāḥ dāruṇāḥ duḥkhāḥ satvānām karma jāḥ ca ye
translated: The terrible sufferings of beings born from their own karma have subsided.

analyzed: praśāntāḥ te ca aṅgārāḥ deha sthāḥ dehi nāśayā
translated: And those embers dwelling in the bodies of embodied beings have also subsided.

original: karapattrā na bādhante kṣuradhārā na sajjate /
analyzed: karapattrāḥ na bādhante kṣura dhārā na sajjate
translated: The hand-leaves do not harm, the razor edges do not stick.

analyzed: ayaḥ śālmalayaḥ bhagnāḥ praśāntāḥ loha kumbhayaḥ
translated: The iron silk-cotton trees are broken, the iron cauldrons have subsided.

original: asipattrāvane pattrā na bādhante karmajā punaḥ /
analyzed: asipattrāvane pattrāḥ na bādhante karma jā punar
translated: In the forest of sword-leaves, the leaves born from karma do not harm again.

original: yamas tvaṃ dharmarājo 'si dharmeṇa śāsayase prajām //
analyzed: yamaḥ tvam dharma rājaḥ si dharmeṇa śāsayase prajām
translated: You are Yama, the Dharma King, you rule the people with Dharma.

original: idaṃ tu kāraṇaṃ nālpam asmākaṃ vaktum arhasi /
analyzed: idam tu kāraṇam na alpam asmākam vaktum arhasi
translated: But you should tell us this not insignificant reason.

analyzed: tatas sau dharmarājā vai dharma ātmā dharma niścayaḥ
translated: Then he, the Dharma King, the righteous one, the one who knows the truth of Dharma,

analyzed: karuṇā śaya naṣṭānām vākyam śrutvā idam īdṛśam
translated: having heard these words of the messengers who had lost their compassion,🔽said this:

original: kim etat kathyatāṃ śīghraṃ kathaṃ tv iti vaco 'vadat //
analyzed: kim etat kathyatām śīghram katham tu iti vacaḥ vadat
translated: What is this? Please tell me quickly.

analyzed: tatas te duṣṭa satvānām yama bhṛtyā su dāruṇāḥ
translated: Then the messengers of Yama, the terrible servants of the evil beings,

analyzed: yamasya dharma rājasya idam vacanam aśrūvan
translated: spoke these words to Yama, the King of Dharma:

analyzed: ayam deva mahā satvaḥ utpannaḥ naraka saṃkaṭe
translated: O Lord, this great being has been born in the danger of hell.

original: avīcir yasya nāmedaṃ tenāsau narakasaṃkaṭa ucyate //
analyzed: avīciḥ yasya nāma idam tena asau naraka saṃkaṭaḥ ucyate
translated: Since this is called Avīci, it is called the danger of hell.

original: karmāṇaṃ yasya vaicitryaṃ satvā ye hi sukhīkṛtam /
analyzed: karmāṇam yasya vaicitryam satvāḥ ye hi sukhīkṛtam
translated: The variety of his actions has made beings happy.

original: sukhino hy eva sarvatra punar yānti surālayam //
analyzed: sukhinaḥ hi eva sarvatra punar yānti surālayam
translated: The happy ones go everywhere again to the abode of the gods.

original: yamo 'pi dharmarājā vai dṛṣṭvā vadati vismitaḥ /
analyzed: yamaḥ pi dharmarājā vai dṛṣṭvā vadati vismitaḥ
translated: Even Yama, the King of Dharma, seeing this, speaks in amazement:

original: maharddhiko 'yaṃ mahac cāsya śarīraṃ pūrvo janmikam //
analyzed: maharddhikaḥ yam mahat ca asya śarīram pūrvaḥ janmikam
translated: This one has great magical power and his body in a former life was great.

original: yathā dhātuśatair vṛndaṃ stūpaṃ śobhati śāśvatam /
analyzed: yathā dhātu śataiḥ vṛndam stūpam śobhati śāśvatam
translated: Just as a stupa shines eternally, surrounded by hundreds of relics,

analyzed: tathā asya śobhate kāyaḥ pratisara ābaddha kaṇṭhakaḥ
translated: so does his body shine, bound by the Prati-sara.

original: atha te narakapālā yakṣā yamasya dharmarājasya idaṃ vacanam abruvan /
analyzed: atha te naraka pālāḥ yakṣāḥ yamasya dharma rājasya idam vacanam abruvan
translated: Then those Yaksas, the wardens of hell, said this to Yama, the King of Dharma:

analyzed: katham iyam deva pratisarā iti ucyate
translated: O Lord, why is this called Prati-sara?

analyzed: dharmarājaḥ uvāca
translated: Yama, the King of Dharma, said:

original: pratipat smārayed yas tu sa na gacchati durgatiṃ sugatiṃ gacchate cāsau pratisarābhāvabhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: pratipad smārayet yaḥ tu sa na gacchati durgatim sugatim gacchate ca asau pratisara abhāva bhāvitaḥ
translated: Whoever reminds himself of the Pratiṣara will not go to a bad rebirth, but will go to a good rebirth, having cultivated the Pratiṣara.

analyzed: yūyam naraka pālāḥ vai gacchatha puṣkarāvatīm
translated: You are the guardians of hell, go to Puṣkarāvatī.

analyzed: tat rakṣatha mahā kūṭam devataiḥ parivāritam
translated: Protect that great fortress surrounded by gods.

analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā sarva sarva sakheṣu maitra cittāḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: Having seen him, you will have a friendly mind towards all friends and enemies.

original: atha te yakṣā yamapuruṣā tasyām eva rātryāṃ puṣkarāvatīṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: atha te yakṣāḥ yama puruṣā tasyām eva rātryām puṣkarāvatīm gatāḥ
translated: Then those Yakṣas, the messengers of Yama, went to Puṣkarāvatī that very night.

analyzed: te paśyanti tadā tatra rājadhānī samīpatas
translated: They saw there, near the royal palace,

analyzed: tat ca kūṭam samantena eka dvāra asamākulam
translated: that fortress surrounded on all sides with a single gate.

analyzed: mṛta śarīram paśyanti pratisara ābaddha kaṇṭhakam
translated: They saw a dead body with the Pratiṣara tied around its neck.

analyzed: devāḥ nāgāḥ ca gandharvāḥ yakṣa rākṣasa kinnarāḥ
translated: Gods, nāgas, gandharvas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, and kinnaras,

analyzed: parivārya samantena pūjām kurvanti anuttarām
translated: surrounding it on all sides, were making the highest worship.

original: yāvat tasya ca tair yakṣaiḥ pratisarākūṭeti nāma sthāpitam //
analyzed: yāvat tasya ca taiḥ yakṣaiḥ pratisarākūṭa iti nāma sthāpitam
translated: Thus, the Yakṣas gave the name Pratiṣara-kūṭa to that fortress.

original: atha te yakṣā punar āgatya yamasya dharmarājasyemaṃ niścayaṃ vistareṇārocayati sma /
analyzed: atha te yakṣā punar āgatya yamasya dharma rājasya imam niścayam vistareṇa ārocayati sma
translated: Then those Yakṣas returned and in detail reported this decision to Yama, the King of the Dharma.

analyzed: evam etat deva tvayā abhihitam
translated: Thus, O god, it has been spoken by you.

original: samanantarodite tasmin vacanaparyavasāne mahāsatvas taṃ nārakaṃ śarīraṃ vijahya trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣūpapannaḥ /
analyzed: samanantara udite tasmin vacana paryavasāne mahāsatvaḥ tam nārakam śarīram vijahya trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu upapannaḥ
translated: Immediately after that conclusion of the statement, the great being abandoned that hellish body and was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: tena hetunā pratisarāpūrvīdeva putraḥ iti ucyate
translated: For that reason, he is called the god who previously had the great protection.

original: tena hi mahābrāhmaṇa parijñātavatī pūrvatas tasmād eveyaṃ mahāpratisarā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā likhitavyā yathāvidhinā nityaṃ śarīragatāṃ
analyzed: tena hi mahā brāhmaṇa parijñātavatī pūrvatas tasmāt eva iyam mahāpratisarā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā likhitavyā yathā vidhinā nityam śarīra gatām
translated: Therefore, O great Brahmin, this great protection has been well known from before. Therefore, it should be upheld, recited, and written according to the proper procedure, always kept on the body.

analyzed: kṛtvā dhārayitavyā
translated: It should be upheld.

analyzed: sa nityam sarva vyasana duḥkhebhyaḥ parimucyate
translated: He is always liberated from all misfortunes and sufferings.

analyzed: sarva durgati bhaya bhairavebhyaḥ uttarati
translated: He overcomes all the fears and terrors of the lower realms.

analyzed: na vidyutā śakyam pātayitum
translated: He cannot be struck by lightning.

analyzed: kim iti vidyutā parijñātam
translated: Why is it well known by lightning?

original: pūrvaṃ mahābrāhmaṇa hiṅgumardane mahānagare vimalaśaṅkho nāma śreṣṭhī mahādhanakanakasamṛddhaḥ paripūrṇakośakośāgārasaṃpanno babhūva /
analyzed: pūrvam mahā brāhmaṇa hiṅgumardane mahā nagare vimalaśaṅkhaḥ nāma śreṣṭhī mahādhana kanaka samṛddhaḥ paripūrṇa kośa kośāgāra saṃpannaḥ babhūva
translated: O great Brahmin, in the past, in the great city of Hiṅgumarda, there was a merchant named Vimalasankha, who was greatly wealthy with gold, and had a treasury and storehouses filled with riches.

analyzed: sa mahā sārthavāhaḥ iti khyātavān
translated: He became known as the great caravan leader.

original: atha sa mahāsārthavāho yānapātram āsādya mahāsamudram avatīrṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa mahā sārthavāhaḥ yānapātram āsādya mahā samudram avatīrṇaḥ
translated: Then that great caravan leader, having obtained a ship, set out on the great ocean.

original: yāvat timiṅgilaiḥ so 'sya poto 'vastabdhaḥ vināśayitukāmā nāgāś ca saṃkṣubdhā mahāntagarjanā sphoṭaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: yāvat timiṅgilaiḥ saḥ sya potaḥ vināśayitu kāmāḥ nāgāḥ ca saṃkṣubdhāḥ mahā anta garjanā sphoṭam kurvanti
translated: As far as the ship was seized by timiṅgila fish, and the nāgas were agitated, desiring to destroy it, making a great roar and a loud noise.

analyzed: vidyut ulkām utsṛjanti vajra aśanim pravarṣitum ārabdhāḥ
translated: They released lightning bolts and started to rain down thunderbolts.

original: tatas te vaṇijo mahatā duḥkhenābhyāhatacittās taṃ mahāntaṃ nāgasaṃkṣobhaṃ vidyudulkāṃ
analyzed: tatas te vaṇijaḥ mahatā duḥkhena abhyāhata cittāḥ tam mahāntam nāga saṃkṣobham vidyut ulkām
translated: Then those merchants, their minds struck by great suffering, saw that great agitation of the nāgas, the lightning bolts,

original: vajrāśaniṃ cotsṛjanti taiś ca timiṅgilaiḥ potam avastabdhaṃ dṛṣṭvā mahāntaṃ utkrośanaṃ
analyzed: vajra aśanim ca utsṛjanti taiḥ ca timiṅgilaiḥ potam avastabdham dṛṣṭvā mahāntam utkrośanam
translated: and the thunderbolts, and that their ship was seized by the timiṅgila fish. Seeing this, they started to cry out loudly

analyzed: śabdam kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: and make a great noise.

analyzed: te viśeṣaiḥ na āyācayanti
translated: They begged for special favors.

original: tatas te sārthavāhasyopagamya karuṇam idaṃ vacanam abruvan /
analyzed: tatas te sārthavāhasya upagamya karuṇam idam vacanam abruvan
translated: Then they approached the caravan leader and spoke these compassionate words:

analyzed: paritrāyasva tvam mahā satva mocaya asmān mahā bhayāt
translated: You, great being, save us! Liberate us from this great danger!

original: atha khalu mahāsārthavāho dṛḍhacitto mahāmatiḥ vaṇijo viklavībhūtān idaṃ vacanam abruvat /
analyzed: atha khalu mahā sārthavāhaḥ dṛḍhacittaḥ mahāmatiḥ vaṇijaḥ viklavībhūtān idam vacanam abruvat
translated: Then the great caravan leader, firm in mind and great in intelligence, said these words to the merchants who had become frightened:🔽Do not be afraid, do not be afraid, O merchants!

original: mā bhair mā bhair vaṇijo bhavanto vīratāṃ vrajata /
analyzed: mā bhaiḥ mā bhaiḥ vaṇijaḥ bhavantaḥ vīra tām vrajata
translated: Do not fear, do not fear, merchants, be heroic!

analyzed: aham vaḥ mocayiṣyāmi atas duḥkha mahā arṇavāt
translated: I will deliver you from this great ocean of suffering.

original: tata vīramānaso bhūtā vaṇija idaṃ vacanam abruvan /
analyzed: tata vīra mānasaḥ bhūtāḥ vaṇijaḥ idam vacanam abruvan
translated: Then, with heroic minds, the merchants spoke these words:

original: kim etat tena mahāsatva brūhi śīghram avighnataḥ /
analyzed: kim etat tena mahā satva brūhi śīghram avighnataḥ
translated: What is this, O great being? Speak quickly without obstruction,

original: yāvad jīvitam asmākaṃ tvat prabhāvād mahāmate kathyatāṃ jñānamahātmyaṃ paścāt kiṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: yāvat jīvitam asmākam tvat prabhāvāt mahāmate kathyatām jñāna mahātmyam paścāt kim kariṣyasi
translated: As long as we live, O greatly wise one, by your power, tell us the greatness of knowledge, what will you do afterwards?

original: tataḥ sārthapatis teṣām imāṃ vidyām udāharat /
analyzed: tatas sārthapatiḥ teṣām imām vidyām udāharat
translated: Then the caravan leader recited this knowledge to them:

original: asti mama mahāvidyā pratisarā nāma viśrutā //
analyzed: asti mama mahā vidyā pratisarā nāma viśrutā
translated: I have a great knowledge, renowned as the Pratiṣara,

analyzed: mardanī sarva buddhānām mahā bala parākramāḥ
translated: Crushing all the Buddhas, with great strength and valor.

analyzed: tena aham mocayiṣyāmi atas duḥkha mahā arṇavāt
translated: By that I will deliver you from this great ocean of suffering.

original: tataḥ mahāsārthavāhas tasyāṃ velāyām imāṃ mahāpratisarāṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ likhitvā dhvajāgrāvaropitāṃ karoti sma /
analyzed: tatas mahā sārthavāhaḥ tasyām velāyām imām mahāpratisarām mahāvidyā rājñīm likhitvā dhvaja agra avaropitām karoti sma
translated: Then the great caravan leader, at that time, having written this great knowledge of the great Pratiṣara, made it hoisted at the top of the flag.

original: samanantaraṃ dhvajāgrāvaropitāyām asyāṃ mahāpratisarāyāṃ mahāvidyārājñyāṃ sarva eva te timiṅgilās taṃ potam ekajvālībhūtaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: samanantaram dhvaja agra avaropitāyām asyām mahāpratisarāyām mahāvidyā rājñyām sarve eva te timiṅgilāḥ tam potam eka jvālībhūtam paśyanti
translated: As soon as this Mahāpratisarā, the great queen of spells, was hoisted at the top of the flag, all those timiṅgila fish saw that ship ablaze with a single flame.

original: tatas te nāgā maitramanasas teṣām antike 'vatīrya pūjāṃ kartum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: tatas te nāgāḥ maitra manasaḥ teṣām antike vatīrya pūjām kartum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then those nāgas, with friendly minds, descended near them and began to make offerings.

original: te ca timiṅgilā asyā mahāpratisarāyā mahāvidyārājñyā anubhāvena dahyamānāḥ /
analyzed: te ca timiṅgilāḥ asyāḥ mahāpratisarāyāḥ mahāvidyā rājñyāḥ anubhāvena dahyamānāḥ
translated: And those timiṅgila fish, by the power of this Mahāpratisarā, the great queen of spells, were burning.

analyzed: prapalāyitvā vilapam gatāḥ
translated: Having fled, they went wailing.

original: sārthikās tair mahānāgair mahati mahāratnadvīpe prāpitā iti //
analyzed: sārthikāḥ taiḥ mahā nāgaiḥ mahati mahā ratna dvīpe prāpitāḥ iti
translated: The merchants were brought by those great nāgas to the great island of jewels.

original: jñātavatīyaṃ mahāvidyā mahāpratisarā sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhitā tena hetunā mahābrāhmaṇa mahāvidyeti khyātā /
analyzed: jñātavatī iyam mahā vidyā mahā pratisarā sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhitā tena hetunā mahā brāhmaṇa mahāvidyā iti khyātā
translated: This great knowledge, the Mahāpratisarā, is known as the great knowledge because it is empowered by all the tathāgatas. For that reason, O great brāhmaṇa, it is known as the great knowledge.

analyzed: tasmāt avaśyam
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: eva iyam dhvaja agrā avaropitam kṛtvā dhārayitavyā
translated: this should definitely be hoisted at the top of the flag and worn.

analyzed: sarva vāta śīta akāla megha vidyut aśanīm praśamayati
translated: It pacifies all winds, cold, untimely clouds, lightning, and thunderbolts.

analyzed: sarva deva manuṣya amanuṣya vigraha vivādeṣu parimocayati
translated: It liberates from all disputes and quarrels with gods, humans, and non-humans.

analyzed: sarva daṃṣṭra maśaka śarabhaka prāṇaka jātāḥ vividha rūpāḥ
translated: All kinds of creatures with fangs, mosquitoes, and sharp horns, of various forms,

analyzed: sasya vināśakāḥ na prabhavanti
translated: The destroyers of crops will not prevail.

analyzed: praśamam gacchanti
translated: They will go to peace.

analyzed: sarva duṣṭa cittāḥ mṛga pakṣi daṃṣṭriṇaḥ vinaśyanti
translated: All evil-minded animals, birds, and fanged creatures will be destroyed.

analyzed: sarvāṇi ca puṣpa phala pattra vanaspati oṣadhi sasya ādīni abhivardhante
translated: And all flowers, fruits, leaves, trees, herbs, and crops will flourish.

analyzed: arasāni svādūni mṛdūni ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be without taste, sweet, and tender.

analyzed: samyak eva paripācitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be properly ripened.

analyzed: ati vṛṣṭyena avṛṣṭi doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvam na bhaviṣyanti
translated: All the faults of excessive rain and drought will not occur at all.

analyzed: kāla vṛṣṭiḥ bhaviṣyanti na akāla vṛṣṭiḥ
translated: There will be timely rain, not untimely rain.

original: ye ca tasmin viṣaye mahānāgās te samyag eva kālena kālaṃ varṣadhārām utsṛjanti /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin viṣaye mahā nāgāḥ te samyak eva kālena kālam varṣa dhārām utsṛjanti
translated: And the great nāgas in that realm will release a rain of water at the proper time.

original: yasmin viṣaye iyaṃ vidyārājñī mahāpratisarā nāma pracariṣyati /
analyzed: yasmin viṣaye iyam vidyā rājñī mahāpratisarā nāma pracariṣyati
translated: In that realm where this knowledge-queen named Mahāpratisarā will be practiced,

original: tatra taiḥ satvair jñātvā pūjāsatkāraṃ kṛtvā nānāgandhair nānāpuṣpair nānāvastraiḥ
analyzed: tatra taiḥ satvaiḥ jñātvā pūjā satkāram kṛtvā nānā gandhaiḥ nānā puṣpaiḥ nānā vastraiḥ
translated: there the beings, having known it, will make offerings and honor it with various fragrances, various flowers, and various garments.

analyzed: pariveṣayitvā caityasya upari dhvaja agra avaropayitām kṛtvā nānā vādya tūrya saṃgītibhiḥ
translated: Having draped it, they will hoist it on the top of a banner above a caitya, and with various musical instruments and songs

analyzed: vādyamānābhiḥ pradakṣiṇīkartavyā
translated: being played, it should be circumambulated.

original: tatas teṣāṃ mahāsatvānāṃ yathā ciñcitam āśāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: tatas teṣām mahāsatvānām yathā ciñcitam āśām paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: Then they will fulfill the hopes and wishes of those great beings, just as they have been conceived.

analyzed: devatāḥ śakra brahma prabhṛtayaḥ
translated: The gods, such as Śakra and Brahmā,

analyzed: athavā yathā yathā vidhinā likhyate tathā tathā samṛdhyate
translated: Or else, just as it is written according to the ritual, so it is accomplished.

original: putrārthī labhate garbhasaṃdhāraṇī parāḥ sukhena vardhate garbhaḥ sukhenaiva prasūyate /
analyzed: putra arthī labhate garbha saṃdhāraṇī parāḥ sukhena vardhate garbhaḥ sukhena eva prasūyate
translated: One who desires a son obtains a son. The supreme dhāraṇī for carrying the fetus. The fetus grows happily. It is delivered easily.

analyzed: kālena vardhate garbhaḥ kālena parimucyate
translated: The fetus grows in time and is delivered in time.

analyzed: kim iti mahābrāhmaṇa pūrvavat śrūyatām
translated: Why is it so, great brāhmaṇa? Listen as before.

original: ihaiva magadhaviṣaye rājā prasāritapāṇir nāma sa cāputrako 'bhūva /
analyzed: iha eva magadha viṣaye rājā prasāritapāṇiḥ nāma sa ca aputrakaḥ bhūva
translated: Here in the Magadha country, there was a king named Prasāritapāṇi. And he was childless.

analyzed: kim iti prasārita pāṇiḥ iti khyātān
translated: Why is he known as Prasāritapāṇi?

original: tena rājñā jātamātreṇa pāṇiṃ prasārya mātuḥ stanau gṛhītvā yāvad āptaṃ kṣīraṃ pītam /
analyzed: tena rājñā jāta mātreṇa pāṇim prasārya mātuḥ stanau gṛhītvā yāvat āptam kṣīram pītam
translated: As soon as that king was born, he stretched out his hand, grabbed his mother's breasts, and drank milk to his satisfaction.

original: tau ca stanau saha sparśamātreṇa suvarṇavarṇau saṃvṛttau /
analyzed: tau ca stanau saha sparśa mātreṇa suvarṇa varṇau saṃvṛttau
translated: And those breasts became golden in color merely by the touch.

analyzed: nityakālam ca mahatā kṣīreṇa pravardhataḥ
translated: And they always grew with great milk.

original: tena kāraṇena tasya rājñaḥ prasāritapāṇir iti nāma sthāpitam /
analyzed: tena kāraṇena tasya rājñaḥ prasāritapāṇiḥ iti nāma sthāpitam
translated: For that reason, the name Prasāritapāṇi was given to that king.

original: anyac ca tasya rājñaḥ yācanakajanā āgacchanti /
analyzed: anyat ca tasya rājñaḥ yācanaka janāḥ āgacchanti
translated: Moreover, to that king, people who are beggars come.

analyzed: tadā sa rājā dakṣiṇa pāṇim prasārayati upari antarikṣe bodhisatvaḥ sa rājā tena hetunā tasya buddha abhiprasannāḥ devatāḥ divyaiḥ ratna viśeṣaiḥ suvarṇa maṇibhiḥ  ca pāṇim paripūrayanti  tadā sa rājā tebhyaḥ yācanaka janebhyaḥ
translated: Then that king extends his right hand into the air. The Bodhisattva king, for that reason, the gods who are devoted to the Buddha fill his hand with divine special jewels, gold and gems,

analyzed: nuprayacchanti
translated: and then that king gives them to the people who are beggars.

analyzed: yathā cinta mātreṇa sarva yācanaka janānām sarva sukha saṃpatti kāmām dadāti
translated: And he gives them as much as they wish, all the desired objects of happiness to all the people who are beggars.

original: devānāṃ ca mahānti pūjāsatkārāṇi karoti putrahetor na ca putraṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: devānām ca mahānti pūjā satkārāṇi karoti putra hetoḥ na ca putram pratilabhate
translated: And he performs great acts of worship and honor for the gods, but he does not obtain a son for the sake of his son.

original: sa paurāṇāṃ tathāgatacaityānāṃ purataḥ pūjāsatkāraṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa paurāṇām tathāgata caityānām puratas pūjā satkāram kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He began to perform acts of worship and honor in front of the ancient stūpas of the Tathāgata.

original: mahānti ca pūjāsatkārāṇi karoti dānāni ca dadāti /
analyzed: mahānti ca pūjā satkārāṇi karoti dānāni ca dadāti
translated: And he performs great acts of worship and honor and gives gifts.

analyzed: upavāsam upavasati
translated: He observes the fast.

analyzed: mahānti ca puṇyāni ca karoti
translated: And he performs great meritorious deeds.

analyzed: akṣiṇāni eva dānāni dadāti
translated: He gives inexhaustible gifts.

original: tat kasya hetor bhūtapūrvaṃ mahābrāhmaṇa asminn eva magadhaviṣaye mallā nāma janapade
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ bhūta pūrvam mahā brāhmaṇa asmin eva magadha viṣaye mallāḥ nāma janapade
translated: What is the reason for that? In the past, Great Brāhmaṇa, in this very Magadha country, in the land of the Mallas,

original: kuśinagare mahāpaṭṭanavare bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya śāsane samutpanno
analyzed: kuśinagare mahā paṭṭana vare bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya śāsane samutpannaḥ
translated: in the excellent great city of Kuśinagara, in the teaching of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna,

original: dharmacittakaḥ kaścid mahāsatvo dharmamatir nāma śreṣṭhī prativasati /
analyzed: dharmacittakaḥ kaścid mahāsatvaḥ dharmamatiḥ nāma śreṣṭhī prativasati
translated: there lived a great being named Dharmamati, a merchant, who had given rise to the Dharma mind.

original: sa sarvasatvānām antike mahākaruṇācittam upasthāpya imām eva mahāvidyāṃ mahāpratisarām ārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: sa sarva satvānām antike mahā karuṇā cittam upasthāpya imām eva mahāvidyām mahāpratisarām ārabhya dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He, having established the mind of great compassion towards all beings, taught the Dharma beginning with this very great knowledge of the great protection.

original: atha kaścid eko daridrapuruṣas taṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā tasya śreṣṭhina idaṃ vacanam abruvat /
analyzed: atha kaścid ekaḥ daridra puruṣaḥ tam dharmam śrutvā tasya śreṣṭhinaḥ idam vacanam abruvat
translated: Then a certain poor man, having heard that Dharma, said these words to that merchant:

original: aham āryasya niveśane bhṛtikarmaṃ kariṣyāmi dharmaṃ ca śroṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham āryasya niveśane bhṛti karmam kariṣyāmi dharmam ca śroṣyāmi
translated: Noble one, I will do work in your house and listen to the Dharma.

original: yadā mama kiṃcid bhaviṣyati tadāhaṃ dharmaṃ pūjayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yadā mama kiṃcid bhaviṣyati tadā aham dharmam pūjayiṣyāmi
translated: When I have something, then I will worship the Dharma.

original: tasya gṛhavyāpāraṃ kurvato dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvato yāvad apareṇa kālasamayena śreṣṭhinā eko dīnāro dattaḥ /
analyzed: tasya gṛha vyāpāram kurvataḥ dharmam ca śṛṇvataḥ yāvat apareṇa kāla samayena śreṣṭhinā ekaḥ dīnāraḥ dattaḥ
translated: While he was doing the work of the house and listening to the Dharma, after some time, the merchant gave him one dīnāra.

original: sa tena sarvasatvaparitrāṇārthaṃ bodhicittam utpādya sādhāṛaṃ kṛtvā mahāpratisarāratneti niryātitā /
analyzed: sa tena sarva satva paritrāṇa artham bodhi cittam utpādya kṛtvā mahāpratisarāratnā iti niryātitā
translated: He, having generated the Awakening Mind for the sake of protecting all sentient beings, having made the proper preparations, offered the great jewel of the Upholder of Great Vows.

original: evaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam anena mahāphalena mama sarvasatvānāṃ ca dāridraduḥkhasaṃcchedaḥ syāt /
analyzed: evam praṇidhānam kṛtam anena mahā phalena mama sarva satvānām ca dāridra duḥkha saṃcchedaḥ syāt
translated: He made this vow: “By this great fruit, may the suffering of poverty be cut off for me and all sentient beings.”

original: anena kāraṇena tad dānaṃ parīkṣayaṃ na gacchati /
analyzed: anena kāraṇena tat dānam parīkṣayam na gacchati
translated: For this reason, that gift does not diminish.

original: evaṃ bahuvidhānekavidhapuṇyābhisaṃskārakṛto devatāś ca pūjitā yāvad buddhā bhagavantaḥ pūjitās tadā ca śuddhāvāsakāyikābhir devatābhiḥ svapne 🔽darśanaṃ dattam /

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi mahābrāhmaṇa nityam eva anusmaraṇa mātreṇa manasi kartavyā
translated: Therefore, O great Brahmin, it should always be kept in mind merely by recollection.

original: sarvakālaṃ ca likhitvā kāyakaṇṭhagatāṃ kṛtvā dhārayitavyā /
analyzed: sarvakālam ca likhitvā kāya kaṇṭha gatām kṛtvā dhārayitavyā
translated: And at all times, having written it down, it should be worn on the body or around the neck.

analyzed: kim iti pūrvavat śrūyatām
translated: Why? Listen as before.

original: ujjayanyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ rājño brahmadattasya vihite kenacit puruṣeṇāparādhaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ujjayanyām mahā nagaryām rājñaḥ brahmadattasya vihite kenacid puruṣeṇa aparādhaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: In the great city of Ujjayini, a certain man committed an offense against King Brahmadatta.

analyzed: sa rājñā brahmadattena vadhaka puruṣebhyaḥ ājñaptaḥ
translated: He was ordered by King Brahmadatta to the executioners,

analyzed: bhavataḥ gacchata enam puruṣam jīvitāt vyaparopayata iti
translated: Go and deprive this man of life.

original: atha te vadhapuruṣās taṃ rājñājñaptaṃ puruṣaṃ gṛhītvā parvatavivaraṃ nītvā asikośān niṣkāsya taṃ puruṣaṃ jīvitād vyaparopayitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha te vadha puruṣāḥ tam rājñā ājñaptam puruṣam gṛhītvā parvata vivaram nītvā asi kośāt niṣkāsya tam puruṣam jīvitāt vyaparopayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then those executioners, having seized the man who was ordered by the king, led him to a mountain cave, drew their swords, and began to deprive the man of life.

original: tadā sa puruṣa imāṃ mahāpratisarāṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ manasā smṛtavān likhitāṃ ca dakṣiṇe bāhau baddhvā dhārayati sma /
analyzed: tadā sa puruṣaḥ imām mahāpratisarām mahāvidyā rājñīm manasā smṛtavān likhitām ca dakṣiṇe bāhau baddhvā dhārayati sma
translated: At that time, that man mentally remembered this great knowledge queen of great protection and wore it on his right arm, having written it down.

original: tasya mahāsatvasyāsyā mahāvidyāyāḥ prabhāvenāsir ekajvālībhūtā khaṇḍakhaṇḍaṃ yathā pāṃśumayo vikīrṇa iti /
analyzed: tasya mahāsatvasya asyāḥ mahāvidyāyāḥ prabhāvena asiḥ ekajvālībhūtā khaṇḍa khaṇḍam yathā pāṃśu mayaḥ vikīrṇaḥ iti
translated: By the power of that great being and this great knowledge, the sword became fragmented like dust scattered in the wind.

original: tatas te vadhakapuruṣā imam evaṃ niścayaṃ rājaṃ vistareṇārocayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: tatas te vadhaka puruṣāḥ imam evam niścayam rājam vistareṇa ārocayāmāsuḥ
translated: Then those executioners went to the king and reported this decision in detail.

analyzed: tatas rājā prakupitaḥ caṇḍībhūtaḥ kathayati
translated: Then the king, becoming angry and enraged, said:

original: gacchata bho puruṣā anyatarasmin pradeśe yakṣaguhāsti /
analyzed: gacchata bho puruṣāḥ anyatarasmin pradeśe yakṣa guhā asti
translated: Go, my men, there is a yaksha cave in a certain place.

analyzed: tatra bahūni yakṣa śata sahasrāṇi prativasanti piśita āśīni
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of flesh-eating yaksas dwell there.

analyzed: tatra nītvā chorayata
translated: Take him there and abandon him.

original: tataḥ sa puruṣo vadhakapuruṣais tasyāṃ yakṣaguhāyāṃ choritaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa puruṣaḥ vadhaka puruṣaiḥ tasyām yakṣa guhāyām choritaḥ
translated: Then that man was abandoned by the executioners in that yaksha cave.

original: samanantara chorite tasmin yakṣaguhāyāṃ tatas te yakṣāḥ sarve tuṣṭamanaso hṛṣṭacittāś ca pradhāvitā mānuṣaṃ bhakṣayiṣyāma iti /
analyzed: samanantara chorite tasmin yakṣa guhāyām tatas te yakṣāḥ sarve tuṣṭa manasaḥ hṛṣṭa cittāḥ ca pradhāvitāḥ mānuṣam bhakṣayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: As soon as he was abandoned in the yaksha cave, all those yakshas, delighted and joyful, ran out, thinking, We will eat human flesh!

original: te paśyanti asyā mahāpratisarāyā mahāvidyārājñyā anubhāvena taṃ puruṣam ekajvalībhūtaṃ dedīpyamānaṃ vigrahaṃ dṛṣṭvā ca sarva eva te yakṣā saṃtrastā
analyzed: te paśyanti asyāḥ mahāpratisarāyāḥ mahāvidyā rājñyāḥ anubhāvena tam puruṣam ekajvalībhūtam dedīpyamānam vigraham dṛṣṭvā ca sarve eva te yakṣā saṃtrastā  /
translated: They saw that man, by the power of this great knowledge of the Great Amulet, blazing with a single flame. Seeing that form, all those yakshas were terrified🔽and frightened, their hair standing on end.

analyzed: dahyamānam sva śarīram paśyanti
translated: They see their own bodies burning.

original: atha te yakṣā vismayaṃ samāpannās taṃ puruṣaṃ gṛhītvā bahirdvāre 'vasthāpya pradakṣiṇīkartum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: atha te yakṣāḥ vismayam samāpannāḥ tam puruṣam gṛhītvā bahirdvāre vasthāpya pradakṣiṇīkartum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then those yakshas, filled with wonder, took that man and placed him outside the door, and began to circumambulate him.

original: yāvat tair vadhakapuruṣai rājñe niścayo 'yaṃ vistareṇāroitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat taiḥ vadhaka puruṣaiḥ rājñe niścayaḥ yam vistareṇa āroitaḥ
translated: Until those executioners reported this matter in detail to the king.

original: tato bhūyo rājā prakupitaś caṇḍībhūtaḥ kathayati /
analyzed: tatas bhūyas rājā prakupitaḥ caṇḍībhūtaḥ kathayati
translated: Then the king became even more angry and said:

original: yad eva bhavanto gacchatainaṃ puruṣaṃ baddhvā nadyāṃ prakṣipata /
analyzed: yat eva bhavantaḥ gacchata enam puruṣam baddhvā nadyām prakṣipata
translated: Just go, sirs, and bind that man and throw him into the river.

original: tataḥ sa puruṣo vadhakapuruṣair baddhvā nadyām prakṣiptaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa puruṣaḥ vadhaka puruṣaiḥ baddhvā nadyām prakṣiptaḥ
translated: Then that man was bound by the executioners and thrown into the river.

original: samanantaraṃ prakṣipte tasmin mahāpuruṣe sā nadī nirudakī bhūtā yatha sa
analyzed: samanantaram prakṣipte tasmin mahāpuruṣe sā nadī nirudakī bhūtā sa
translated: As soon as that great man was thrown in, that river became shallow, so that

analyzed: puruṣaḥ sthala gataḥ eva tiṣṭhati
translated: that man stood on dry land.

analyzed: tāni ca bandhanāni khaṇḍa khaṇḍam vicūrṇitāni
translated: And those bonds were shattered to pieces.

original: rājā śrutvā tato rājā vismitotphullavadanaḥ kathayati /
analyzed: rājā śrutvā tatas rājā vismita utphulla vadanaḥ kathayati
translated: When the king heard this, then the king, with a face blooming with wonder, said:

analyzed: aho vismayam idam puruṣasya dṛśyate
translated: Oh, this is a wonder that is seen in the man.

original: kim atra kāraṇaṃ syād iti me vitarkaḥ /
analyzed: kim atra kāraṇam syāt iti me vitarkaḥ
translated: What could be the cause of this? I think.

original: atha sa rājā taṃ puruṣam āhūyainam āha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā tam puruṣam āhūya enam āha
translated: Then the king, summoning that man, said to him:

analyzed: kim tvam bhoḥ puruṣa jānāsi
translated: What do you know, sir?

analyzed: sa puruṣaḥ uvāca
translated: The man said:

analyzed: na aham mahā rāja kiṃcid api jānāmi
translated: Great king, I know nothing at all,

analyzed: anyatra mahāpratisarām mahāvidyā rājñīm dhārayāmi
translated: except that I possess the great knowledge mantra of the Great Amulet.

analyzed: asyāḥ eṣa deva mahā prabhāvaḥ
translated: This, O king, is its great power.

analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

analyzed: aho āścaryam idam mahat
translated: Ah, this is a great wonder!
The great knowledge mantra has been well spoken,

analyzed: mohanī mṛtyu daṇḍasya sarva buddhaiḥ adhiṣṭhitā
translated: it deludes the staff of death, and is empowered by all the Buddhas.

analyzed: tāraṇī sarva satvānām sarva duḥkha pramocanī
translated: It is the savior of all beings, liberating them from all suffering,
the great knowledge mantra of great splendor, liberating from untimely death,

analyzed: bhāṣitā kāruṇikaiḥ nāthaiḥ mahā roga nivāriṇī
translated: spoken by the compassionate lords, preventing great illness.

original: tato rājñā prahṛṣṭamānasena mahāpratisarā mahāvidyārājñī pūjitā mānitābhinanditā /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prahṛṣṭa mānasena mahāpratisarā mahāvidyā rājñī pūjitā mānitā abhinanditā
translated: Then the king, with a delighted mind, worshipped, honored, and praised the Great Amulet, the great knowledge mantra.

original: tasya puruṣasya poṭṭabandhaṃ kṛtvā svasya janapadasya purastān nagarajyeṣṭhatāyām abhiṣeko dattaḥ /
analyzed: tasya puruṣasya poṭṭabandham kṛtvā svasya janapadasya purastāt nagara jyeṣṭha tāyām abhiṣekaḥ dattaḥ
translated: He gave the man a turban and consecrated him as the chief of the city in his own country.

original: evaṃ hi mahābrāhmaṇa iyaṃ mahāpratisarā mahāvidyārājñī sarvatra mahatīpūjāṃ labhate /
analyzed: evam hi mahā brāhmaṇaḥ iyam mahāpratisarā mahāvidyā rājñī sarvatra mahatī pūjām labhate
translated: Thus, O great Brahmin, this Great Amulet, the great knowledge mantra, receives great worship everywhere.

analyzed: an abhikramaṇīyā sarva duṣṭa cittaiḥ sarvaiḥ pūjanīyā
translated: It should not be approached by anyone with an evil mind, but should be worshipped by all.

original: evaṃ hi mahābrāhmaṇa pūrvam iyaṃ mahāpratisarā mahāvidyārājñī na kvacit pratihanyate /
analyzed: evam hi mahā brāhmaṇa pūrvam iyam mahāpratisarā mahāvidyā rājñī na kvacid pratihanyate
translated: Thus, O great Brahmin, this great powerful queen of spells, the Great Amulet, is not obstructed anywhere.

original: tasmād avaśyam iyaṃ mahāvidyārājñī kāyakaṇṭhagatāṃ kṛtvā dhārayitavyā /
analyzed: tasmāt avaśyam iyam mahāvidyā rājñī kāya kaṇṭha gatām kṛtvā dhārayitavyā
translated: Therefore, this great powerful queen of spells should definitely be worn on the body or around the neck.

original: api tu mahābrāhmaṇa manukṣetreṇeyaṃ mahāvidyārājñī supraśastena vidhānena likhitavyā //
analyzed: api tu mahābrāhmaṇa manu kṣetreṇa iyam mahāvidyā rājñī su praśastena vidhānena likhitavyā
translated: Moreover, O great Brahmin, this great powerful queen of spells should be written in a pure place with a very pure ritual.

original: atha sa mahābrāhmaṇo 'tīva prahṛṣṭamanasā bhagavantaṃ pañcamaṇḍalakenābhipraṇamya praṣṭum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa mahā brāhmaṇaḥ tīva prahṛṣṭa manasā bhagavantam pañca maṇḍalakena abhipraṇamya praṣṭum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then that great Brahmin, with a mind extremely delighted, bowed to the Blessed One with the five-part prostration and began to ask:

original: kīdṛśena bhadanta bhagavan vidhāneneyaṃ mahāpratisarā mahāvidyārājñī likhitavyā //
analyzed: kīdṛśena bhadanta bhagavan vidhānena iyam mahāpratisarā mahāvidyā rājñī likhitavyā
translated: In what kind of ritual, O Venerable Blessed One, should this great powerful queen of spells, the Great Amulet, be written?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śṛṇu mahābrāhmaṇa tvām ahaṃ vakṣye sarvasatvānukaṃpayā /
analyzed: śṛṇu mahā brāhmaṇa tvām aham vakṣye sarva satva anukaṃpayā
translated: Listen, O great Brahmin, I will tell you out of compassion for all beings.

original: yena satvāḥ sukhino bhontu mucyatai karmasaṃkaṭāt //
analyzed: yena satvāḥ sukhinaḥ bhontu mucyatai karma saṃkaṭāt
translated: By which beings may become happy and be freed from the danger of karma.

analyzed: vyādhitānām ca mokṣa artham strīṇām garbha samudbhavam
translated: And for the sake of liberation of the sick, and for the birth of children in women,

analyzed: bhaviṣyati ca satvānām dāridrya varaṇa rohaṇam
translated: And will remove the obscuration of poverty for beings.

analyzed: upavāsa uṣitaḥ bhūtvā nakṣatre puṣya saṃmate
translated: Having fasted, under the constellation considered to be Puṣya,

analyzed: buddha pūjā paraḥ bhūtvā cittam utpācya bodhaye
translated: Devoted to the worship of the Buddha, having generated the mind for enlightenment,

analyzed: karuṇā āmreḍita cittena maitryā ca api samanvitaḥ
translated: With a mind moistened with compassion, and also endowed with loving-kindness,

analyzed: hita ādhāna paraḥ ca api sarva satveṣu nityaśas
translated: And always intent on establishing benefit for all beings,

analyzed: snātvā candana karpūraiḥ kastūrī salilena ca
translated: Having bathed in water scented with sandalwood, camphor, and musk,

analyzed: śuci vastrāṇi prāvṛtya dhūpitāni ca dhūpanaiḥ
translated: And having put on clean clothes, which have been perfumed with incense,

analyzed: tatas maṇḍalakam kṛtvā śṛṅga umaya samanvitam
translated: Then, having made a maṇḍala with cow dung,

analyzed: pañca raṅgika cūrṇena citraya maṇḍalam śubham
translated: One should paint the auspicious maṇḍala with five-colored powders.

analyzed: pūrṇa kumbhāḥ ca caturaḥ pañcamam madhya maṇḍale
translated: And the four full water pots, the fifth in the middle maṇḍala,

original: puṣpadhūpāś ca gandhāś ca dātavyātra mahārihā //
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpāḥ ca gandhāḥ ca dātavyā atra mahā ari hā
translated: Here, the great hero should offer flowers, incense, and perfumes.

original: dhūpanaṃ candanaṃ caiva spṛkkāguru tathaiva ca /
analyzed: dhūpanam candanam ca eva spṛkkā aguru tathā eva ca
translated: Incense, sandalwood, spṛk (a kind of fragrant grass), and agaru (Aquilaria agallocha),

analyzed: pañcaśarkarā rukmā ca dātavyā atra vidhānataḥ
translated: And the five kinds of sugar and gold, should be offered here according to the rules.

analyzed: nānāvidhāni puṣpāṇi yathākālam yathā vidhiḥ
translated: Various kinds of flowers, according to the season and the rules,

analyzed: sarva puṣpa phalaiḥ bījaiḥ gandhaiḥ ca api su maṇḍitān
translated: Well-adorned with all flowers, fruits, seeds, and perfumes,🔽Here, the great hero should offer flowers, incense, and perfumes.

analyzed: ghṛta mākṣika dugdhaiḥ ca pāvakaiḥ payasā ādibhiḥ
translated: With ghee, honey, milk, and other purifying substances,

original: pūrayed balikumbhāś ca lakṣaṇād yān sumaṅgalān //
analyzed: pūrayet bali kumbhāḥ ca lakṣaṇāt yān su maṅgalān
translated: And fill the offering pots, which are very auspicious according to the characteristics.

analyzed: sthāpayet caturaḥ dikṣu pañcamam madhya maṇḍale
translated: And place four in the four directions, and the fifth in the central mandala.

analyzed: sthāpanīyāḥ śarāvān ca koṇeṣu gandha pūritāḥ
translated: And offering bowls filled with perfume should be placed in the corners.

analyzed: catvāraḥ kīlakāḥ ca api khādirāḥ dṛḍha veśitāḥ
translated: And four strong wooden pegs made of khadira wood,

analyzed: pañca raṅgika sūtreṇa veśayitvā vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: The wise ones should string them with five-colored thread,

analyzed: sama bhāgena sthāpyetām nipatya āt maṇḍalāt bahis
translated: And place them outside the mandala at equal intervals.

original: evaṃ kṛte likhed vipra yad icchet siddhim ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: evam kṛte likhet vipra yat icchet siddhim ātmanaḥ
translated: When this is done, O Brahmin, one should draw it if one desires success for oneself.

analyzed: śukla bhojana bhuktena likhitavyam sukha eṣiṇā
translated: One who desires happiness should draw it while eating white food,

original: paṭṭe vā vastrabhūrje vānyatra vā yatra kutracit //
analyzed: paṭṭe vā vastra bhūrje vā anyatra vā yatra kutracid
translated: On a cloth, birch bark, or anywhere else.

original: likhet strīṣu ca putrārthī samyaggorocanena vai /
analyzed: likhet strīṣu ca putra arthī samyak gorocanena vai
translated: And one who desires sons and women should draw them properly with vermillion.

original: madhye ca dārakaṃ kuryāt sarvālaṃkārabhūṣitam //🔽ratnapūrṇaṃ tathā pātraṃ vāmahastena dhārayet /
analyzed: madhye ca dārakam kuryāt sarva alaṃkāra bhūṣitam  ratna pūrṇam tathā pātram vāma hastena dhārayet
translated: And in the middle one should make a child adorned with all ornaments,🔽And holding in the left hand a vessel filled with jewels,

analyzed: kārye padme
translated: Seated in a lotus to be done, adorned with full-blown flowers.

analyzed: maṇi hāra suvarṇam ca nānā ratna viśeṣataḥ
translated: With jewels, necklaces, gold, and various special gems,

analyzed: pravarṣaḥ ca api kartavyāḥ catuḥ koṇeṣu parvatāḥ
translated: And also rain showers, and in the four corners, mountains.

original: evaṃ likhet prayatnena yad icched jīvitaṃ sukham /
analyzed: evam likhet prayatnena yat icchet jīvitam sukham
translated: One should write this carefully, if one desires a happy life.

analyzed: kuṅkumena likhet prājñaḥ puruṣāṇām viśeṣataḥ
translated: The wise one should write with saffron, especially for men.

analyzed: tasya īpsitāni kāryāṇi sidhyante na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: His desired actions will be accomplished, there is no doubt about this.

original: nānārūpāś ca kartavyā mudrācihnaś ca padminī //
analyzed: nānā rūpāḥ ca kartavyāḥ mudrā cihnaḥ ca padminī
translated: And various forms should be made, with the sign of a lotus.

analyzed: dve padme athavā trīṇi catvāri pañca vā likhet
translated: One should write two, three, four, or five lotuses.

original: padmānāṃ ca tathā kuryāt keśarāṇi samantataḥ //🔽supuṣpitaṃ padmaṃ kurvīta sadaṇḍaṃ paṭṭabaddhakam /

translated: And likewise, one should make the filaments all around the lotuses.🔽One should make a fully blossomed lotus with a stalk and a ribbon.

translated: One should make a trident in the lotus, then a corner with a ribbon.🔽One should make an axe in the lotus, then leaves all around.

analyzed: sa khaṅgam padmam kurvīta tat padmam śitam eva ca  śaṅkham padme tathā kuryāt sarvatra vidhi vistaram

analyzed: sarvatra vidhi cihnāni kārayet su vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The skillful one should make all the signs according to the procedure.

analyzed: varjayet bāla rūpāṇi yatra cittam praduṣyati
translated: One should avoid forms of children where the mind becomes defiled.

analyzed: deva rūpāḥ ca kartavyāḥ nānā alaṃkāra bhūṣitā
translated: They should be made in the form of gods, adorned with various ornaments.

original: bhikṣuṃ vajradharaṃ kuryād duṣṭatarjanaṃ tat param /
analyzed: bhikṣum vajra dharam kuryāt duṣṭa tarjanam tat param
translated: One should make a monk holding a vajra, threatening the wicked.

analyzed: caturaḥ ca mahārājān catuḥ pārśveṣu saṃlikhet
translated: And one should draw the four great kings on the four sides.

analyzed: brāhmaṇeṣu īśvaraḥ lekhyaḥ kṣatriyeṣu maheśvaraḥ
translated: Brahma should be drawn among Brahmins, Mahesvara among Kshatriyas,

analyzed: śūdreṣu ca sadā saumyam cakra svāminam ālikhet

original: panthānaṃ labhate śīghraṃ bhojanaṃ pānam uttamam /🔽karmaṇā manasā vācā yat kṛtaṃ pūrvajanmasu //
analyzed: panthānam labhate śīghram bhojanam pānam uttamam  karmaṇā manasā vācā yat kṛtam pūrva janmasu
translated: One quickly obtains the path, the best food and drink,🔽Whatever inauspicious and various deeds have been done in past lives,

original: aśubhaṃ bahuvidhā kiṃcit sarvaṃ kṣayayiṣyati /🔽smaraṇād dhāraṇāc caiva udgrahāl likhanād api //
analyzed: aśubham bahuvidhā kiṃcid sarvam kṣayayiṣyati  smaraṇāt dhāraṇāt ca eva udgrahāt likhanāt api
translated: By body, mind, or speech, all of it will be destroyed.🔽By remembering, retaining, reciting, and writing,

analyzed: paṭhanāt vacanāt ca eva jayanāt para deśanāt
translated: By reading, speaking, conquering, and teaching others,

analyzed: bhaviṣyati acireṇa asau sarva dharma gatim gataḥ
translated: Before long, he will attain the state of all dharmas.

original: evaṃ hi dharmarase prāpte pāpā gacchanti saṃkṣayam /
analyzed: evam hi dharma rase prāpte pāpāḥ gacchanti saṃkṣayam
translated: Thus, when the taste of Dharma is attained, all sins are destroyed.

original: sidhyante sarvakarmāṇi manasā yad yad īpsitam //
analyzed: sidhyante sarva karmāṇi manasā yat yat īpsitam
translated: All actions are accomplished, whatever is desired by the mind.

analyzed: sarva mṛtyu bhaye ca eṣām trāṇam tasya bhaviṣyati
translated: For them, he will be a protector from all fear of death.

original: rājāgnir udakaṃ caiva vidyud vā taskaro 'pi vā //
analyzed: rāja agniḥ udakam ca eva vidyut vā vā
translated: Whether from the king, fire, water, lightning, or thieves,

analyzed: yuddha saṃgrāma kalahāḥ daṃṣṭriṇaḥ ye ca dāruṇāḥ
translated: And from battles, conflicts, and the terrible fanged creatures,

original: sarve te pralapaṃ yānti vidyāyā lakṣajāyātaḥ //
analyzed: sarve te pralapam yānti vidyāyāḥ lakṣajāyāḥ
translated: All of them will go to hell, even if they have a hundred thousand recitations of the Vidyā.

original: vidyemāṃ paramāṃ siddhāṃ sarvabuddhair hi deśitā /
analyzed: vidyā imām paramām siddhām sarva buddhaiḥ hi deśitā
translated: This supreme Vidyā, taught by all the Buddhas, is accomplished.

analyzed: kīrti mānāḥ na sīdanti bodhi saṃbhāra pūraye
translated: Those who are famous and honored do not sink, but fulfill the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: sarveṣu caiva sthāneṣu imāṃ vidyāṃ prayojayet /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca eva sthāneṣu imām vidyām prayojayet
translated: And in all places, one should employ this Vidyā,

analyzed: yāni ca icchanti kāryāṇi sva para artha prasiddhaye
translated: And whatever actions they desire for the accomplishment of their own and others' goals,

analyzed: sidhyanti vidyātaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: They are accomplished effortlessly through the Vidyā, there is no doubt about this.

original: namaḥ sarvatathāgatebhyo ye 'pi tiṣṭhanti daśasu dikṣu //
analyzed: namaḥ sarva tathāgatebhyaḥ ye tiṣṭhanti daśasu dikṣu
translated: Homage to all the Tathāgatas, those who abide in the ten directions.

original: oṃ maṇivajre hṛdayavaire mārasainyavidāriṇi hana sarvaśatrūn rakṣa mama śarīraṃ sarvasatvānāṃ ca vajre vajragarbhe /
analyzed: om maṇivajre hṛdaya vaire māra sainya vidāriṇi hana sarva śatrūn rakṣa mama śarīram sarva sattvānām ca vajre vajragarbhe
translated: Oṃ, O jewel-vajra, O heart of the enemy, O destroyer of the armies of Māra, O slayer of all enemies, protect my body and that of all beings, O vajra, O vajra-womb.

original: trāsaya sarvamārabhavanāni hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: trāsaya sarva māra bhavanāni hūm hūm phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Terrify all the abodes of Māra, hūṃ hūṃ, phaṭ phaṭ, svāhā.

analyzed: buddha maitrī sarva tathāgata vajra kalpa dhiṣṭhite sarva karma āvaraṇāni apanaya svāhā
translated: Blessed by the Buddha, Maitreya, all the Tathāgatas, and the Vajra-enjoined, remove all karmic obscurations, svāhā.

analyzed: tat idānīm pravakṣāmi āturāṇām
translated: Now I will explain the treatment of the sick.

analyzed: caturaśram maṇḍalakam kuryāt mṛd gomaya samanvitam
translated: One should make a square maṇḍala, mixed with clay and cow dung.
One should draw a beautiful maṇḍala with five-colored powders.

original: caturaḥ pūrṇakuṃbhāṃś ca sthāpayed vidhinā budhaḥ //
analyzed: caturaḥ pūrṇa kuṃbhān ca sthāpayet vidhinā budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should install four full vases according to the ritual.

original: puṣpāṇy avakiret tatra dhūpayed dhūpam uttamam /
analyzed: puṣpāṇi avakiret tatra dhūpayet dhūpam uttamam
translated: One should scatter flowers there and burn the best incense.

analyzed: bali karmam ca kurvīta mahā sāhasra pramardanam
translated: One should perform the bali offering, the great destroyer of the thousand.

analyzed: pūrvavat gandha puṣpa ādīn dadyāt ca atra vidhānataḥ
translated: One should offer here according to the ritual the fragrances, flowers, and so forth as before.

original: caturas tīrikāḥ sthāpyāḥ sarvāś ca paṭṭabaddhakāḥ //🔽sthāpayitvāturaṃ paścāc chucivastrasamāvṛtam /
analyzed: caturaḥ tīrikāḥ sthāpyāḥ sarvāḥ ca paṭṭabaddhakāḥ  sthāpayitvā āturam paścāt śuci vastra samāvṛtam
translated: Four boundary markers should be set up, all tied with silk.🔽Having placed the patient behind, covered with clean clothes,

analyzed: śubha gandha anulipta aṅgam praveśayet madhya maṇḍale
translated: with his body anointed with auspicious fragrances, one should make him enter the middle maṇḍala.

analyzed: pūrvā mukham niṣadya etām etām vidyām udāharet
translated: Having sat facing east, one should recite this knowledge.

original: saptaso japtayā cāsya rakṣāṃ kuryād vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: saptasaḥ japtayā ca asya rakṣām kuryāt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should perform protection for him by reciting it seven times.

analyzed: āturasya tatas rthāya vārān ca api ekaviṃśati
translated: Then, for the sake of the patient,

original: udāhared imāṃ vidyāṃ sarvarogopaśāntaye //🔽bhūyaś ca saptavārān vai varikumbhaṃ sumantritam /
analyzed: udāharet imām vidyām sarva roga upaśāntaye  bhūyas ca sapta vārān vai vari kumbham su mantritam
translated: one should recite this knowledge twenty-one times for the pacification of all diseases.🔽Again, the wise one should recite the well-formulated water vase

analyzed: paścāt niveśayet mantrī vari puṣpam yathā vidhiḥ
translated: seven times, and then install the water flower according to the ritual.

original: ity evaṃ dakṣiṇe pārśve prakṣipet sapta eva tu /
analyzed: iti evam dakṣiṇe pārśve prakṣipet sapta eva tu
translated: Thus, on the right side, one should throw seven [darts].

original: paścimā yāntu saptaiva uttarāyāṃ tathā diśi //
analyzed: paścimāḥ yāntu sapta eva uttarāyām tathā diśi
translated: Let there be seven in the west, and likewise in the northern direction.

original: adha ūrdhvaṃ tu saptaiva kṛtā rakṣā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adhas ūrdhvam tu saptā eva kṛtā rakṣā bhaviṣyati
translated: Seven [darts] below and above, the protection will be made.

analyzed: evam kṛte dvijaśreṣṭha sarva duḥkhāt parimucyate
translated: When this is done, O best of brahmins, one is freed from all suffering.

original: eṣā rakṣā mayā khyātā śākyasiṃhena bhāṣitā /
analyzed: eṣā rakṣā mayā khyātā śākyasiṃhena bhāṣitā
translated: This protection has been proclaimed by me, spoken by the Lion of the Shakyas.

original: nāsty asyāḥ parā kācid rakṣā vidyā tridhātuke //
analyzed: na asti asyāḥ parā kācid rakṣā vidyā tridhātuke
translated: There is no higher protection than this, no knowledge in the three realms.

original: na tasya mṛtyur na jarā na rogo na ca priyair jātuviyogabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tasya mṛtyuḥ na jarā na rogaḥ na ca priyaiḥ jātu viyoga bhāvaḥ
translated: For him there is no death, no old age, no disease, and never separation from loved ones.

original: na cāpriyais tasya hi saṃprayogo bhaved dhiyo bhāvitacittasaṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: na ca apriyaiḥ tasya hi saṃprayogaḥ bhavet dhiyaḥ bhāvita citta saṃtatiḥ
translated: And for him there is no association with what is unpleasant, if the continuum of his mind is cultivated.

original: yamo 'pi tasya varadharmarājā kariṣyate pūjāṃ sagauraveṇa /
analyzed: yamaḥ pi tasya vara dharma rājā kariṣyate pūjām sa gauraveṇa
translated: Even Yama, the king of the Dharma, will respectfully offer worship to him.

original: kathayiṣyate devasuraṃ hi gacha kṣaṇikaṃ mamedaṃ narakapurajvāriṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: kathayiṣyate deva suram hi gacha kṣaṇikam mama idam naraka pura jvārim kariṣyasi
translated: He will say, Go to the assembly of gods and demons. For a moment you will be the executioner of the city of hell.

original: tato vimānaiḥ subahuprakārarir maharddhiko yāti surālayaṃ śubham /
analyzed: tatas vimānaiḥ su bahu prakāra ariḥ maharddhikaḥ yāti surālayam śubham
translated: Then, with a great deal of various celestial palaces, he will go to the auspicious abode of the gods, endowed with great power.

original: evaṃ hy asau naramarudyakṣarākṣasaiḥ saṃpūjitas tatra sadā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam hi asau nara marut yakṣa rākṣasaiḥ saṃpūjitaḥ tatra sadā bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, he will always be worshipped there by men, gods, yakshas, and rakshasas.

original: vajrapāṇiś ca yakṣendra indra caiva śacīpatiḥ /
analyzed: vajrapāṇiḥ ca yakṣa indraḥ indra ca eva śacīpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the Yakshas with the thunderbolt in his hand, and Indra, the lord of Shachi,

analyzed: hārītī pāñcikaḥ ca eva lokapālāḥ mahārddhikāḥ
translated: Hārītī, Pāñcika, and the world guardians of great power,

analyzed: candra sūryau sa nakṣatrau ye grahāḥ parama dāruṇāḥ
translated: The moon and sun with the constellations, and the extremely terrible planets,

original: te ca sarve mahānāgā devatā ṛṣayas tathā //
analyzed: te ca sarve mahā nāgāḥ devatāḥ ṛṣayaḥ tathā
translated: And all those great nāgas, gods, and sages,

original: asurā garuḍā gandharvāḥ kinnarāś ca mahoragāḥ /
analyzed: asurāḥ garuḍāḥ gandharvāḥ kinnarāḥ ca mahoragāḥ
translated: Asuras, Garuḍas, Gandharvas, Kinnaras, and great serpents,

analyzed: nitya anubuddha ārakṣā artham yasya vidyā mahā balāḥ
translated: Whose great and powerful knowledge is always followed for the sake of protection,

original: likhitāṃ dhārayet prājño bāhau baddhvā maharddhikāḥ /
analyzed: likhitām dhārayet prājñaḥ bāhau baddhvā maharddhikāḥ
translated: The wise one should write and wear on the arm, bound with great power,

original: mahatīṃ labhate pūjāṃ saṃpadaṃ cāpi nityaśa iti //
analyzed: mahatīm labhate pūjām saṃpadam ca api nityaśas iti
translated: He will obtain great worship and prosperity always.

analyzed: mahāpratisarāyāḥ vidyā rājñaḥ rakṣā vidhāna kalpaḥ vidyādharasya samāptaḥ
translated: The ritual manual of the protection vidyā of the great knowledge king Mahāpratisarā is completed.
